topic.title: About the DITAVAL document
topic.shortdesc: A DITAVAL document specifies a set of rules that defines which elements to include, exclude, or flag.

body.p: The markup for DITAVAL documents provides a standard way to define all conditional processing associated with the DITA specification.

Each rule in a DITAVAL document does one of the following:
Defines a rendering behavior for an attribute / value pair, such audience="novice".
Defines a default behavior for a conditional processing attribute, such as defining a default rendering behavior of exclude for the deliveryTarget. With that default, any deliveryTarget value not otherwise defined in the document uses that default behavior of exclude.
Defines a default behavior for all conditional processing attributes, such as defining a default rendering behavior of exclude. With that default, any attribute or attribute value not otherwise defined in the document uses that default behavior of exclude.
While the DITAVAL markup is not part of the DITA topic or map vocabulary (and cannot be specialized), the XML itself is part of the specification; see for details.
